description.value: `<market-accessory>` is used to display a slotted image or icon, and is intended to be used as a slotted leading or trailing accessory in `<market-row>` and `<market-input-text>`.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description:
The desired size for the leading or trailing accessory, which we expect to
be either an image or a <market-icon> component. The available sizes are
"icon" (24x24) and "image" (40x40).

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Whether the accordion should appear in a disabled state.

attributes.name: expanded
attributes.description: Determines whether the accordion is shown as expanded or collapsed.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The unique name of the accordion.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: The size of the heading text of the accordion.

description.value:
`<market-action-card>` is intended for card scenarios that are either "action-oriented" or "selectable". The entire card is a touch target with an elevated treatment intended to make the card appear to be tappable.

You can slot `<market-row>` (with or without slotted controls like `<market-radio>` or `<market-checkbox>`) into `<market-action-card>`.

`<market-action-card>` can be used inside of `<market-list>`.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Visually and functionally disables the action card.

attributes.name: selected
attributes.description: Whether the action card is selected or not.

attributes.name: transient
attributes.description: When set to `true`, card will not persist selected state on click.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: A string specifying a value for the action card.

description.value: A component used to model a radial activity indicator, to be used inside other components.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: String for setting activity indicator size

description.value: A component used to model an activity bar indicator, to be used inside other components.

attributes.name: max
attributes.description: The maximum value of the activity bar

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The value the activity bar should report

description.value: market-banner displays a message and has the option to add a dismiss button or another action button.

attributes.name: dismiss-button-aria-label
attributes.description:
Optional property to pass a string to the dismiss "x"
that will function as its aria-label. Defaults to "Dismiss".

attributes.name: dismissable
attributes.description: whether to show the dismiss "x" or not

attributes.name: icon-image-title
attributes.description:
Title for the icon image, used as the accessible name for the icon.
If a custom icon is provided, this prop is ignored.

attributes.name: variant
attributes.description: banner variant that corresponds to the type of info it is conveying

attributes.name: animation-duration
attributes.description: DEPRECATED: The duration for the blade enter/exit animations, set from design tokens

attributes.name: animation-enter-duration
attributes.description: The duration for the modal enter animation, set from design tokens

attributes.name: animation-exit-duration
attributes.description: The duration for the modal exit animation, set from design tokens

attributes.name: data-dialog-id
attributes.description: INTERNAL ONLY: Used by the context manager to identify a specific dialog/modal

attributes.name: hidden
attributes.description: INTERNAL ONLY: Used in CSS to trigger start and stop animations

attributes.name: data-dialog-index
attributes.description:
INTERNAL ONLY: Used by the context manager to identify a specific dialog/modal's place
in the stack

attributes.name: trap-focus
attributes.description: Enforces focus trapping on the modal

description.value: In addition to being a button, `market-button` is also our very first Market component!

attributes.name: caret
attributes.description: String for setting (optional) button caret direction

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Functionally and visually disables the button

attributes.name: download
attributes.description:
Causes the browser to treat the linked URL as a download. Only works for same-origin URLs.
Only applies when an `href` is provided.
See [here](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/a#attr-download) for details on accepted values.

attributes.name: focused
attributes.description: Whether or not the button is in a focused state

attributes.name: href
attributes.description:
Contains a URL or a URL fragment that the hyperlink points to.
If this property is set, an anchor tag will be rendered.

attributes.name: icon-only
attributes.description: Whether the button only contains an icon.

attributes.name: inner-tabindex
attributes.description: Optionally set a custom tabindex on the inner HTML `<button>`.

attributes.name: is-loading
attributes.description: Whether or not the button is in a loading state

attributes.name: rank
attributes.description: String for setting button rank

attributes.name: rel
attributes.description:
Defines the relationship between a linked resource and the current document.
Only applies when an `href` is provided.
See [here](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/rel) for details on accepted values.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: String for setting button size

attributes.name: target
attributes.description:
Specifies where to display the linked URL.
Only applies when an `href` is provided.
See [here](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/a#attr-target) for details on accepted values.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: String for setting button type

attributes.name: variant
attributes.description: String for setting button variant

description.value:
This component uses `<market-dropdown>` to create a component that has a `<market-button>` and slotted content. Interacting with the button will open the slotted content in a `<market-popover>` which is positioned using Popper.js.

To tweak the position of the dropdown button's popover, you can style `market-button-dropdown::part(popover)` directly using CSS.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Functionally and visually disables the button dropdown.

attributes.name: interaction
attributes.description:
Defines what types of interaction the button dropdown should have
(see `market-dropdown` docs for more granular explanation)

attributes.name: no-caret
attributes.description: Disabling the up/down caret.

attributes.name: persist-list
attributes.description: Disables the default behavior of *not* persisting selections in slotted `market-list`s.

attributes.name: popover-placement
attributes.description:
Configuration option for Popper.js (used to position `<market-popover>`).
Describes the preferred placement of the popper.
https://popper.js.org/docs/v2/constructors//#placement

attributes.name: popover-strategy
attributes.description:
Configuration option for Popper.js (used to position `<market-popover>`).
Describes the positioning strategy to use. By default, it is absolute. If
your reference element is in a fixed container, use the fixed strategy.
https://popper.js.org/docs/v2/constructors//#strategy

description.value: A component to organize and maintain multiple buttons within a page or component. It handles button alignment and button overflow based on screen size. Should be used with the <market-button> component.

attributes.name: alignment
attributes.description:
A string specifying the alignment for the button group.
This will change button size and distribution across the group.

attributes.name: popover-strategy
attributes.description:
Configuration option for Popper.js (used to position `<market-popover>`).
Describes the positioning strategy to use. By default, it is absolute. If
your reference element is in a fixed container, use the fixed strategy.
https://popper.js.org/docs/v2/constructors//#strategy

description.value:
`<market-checkbox>` can be used on its own, or slotted into `<market-row>` as a control. When used with `market-row`,
the row's `selected` prop overrides the checkbox's `checked` prop.

attributes.name: active
attributes.description: Whether the checkbox is active or not.

attributes.name: checked
attributes.description:
Whether the checkbox is checked or unchecked. Operates independently of the indeterminate property.
If used as a slotted control inside of `market-row`, this will be overridden by the row's `selected` property.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Whether the checkbox is disabled.

attributes.name: focused
attributes.description: Whether the checkbox is focused or not.

attributes.name: hovered
attributes.description: Whether the checkbox is hovered or not.

attributes.name: indeterminate
attributes.description: Whether the checkbox is indeterminate. If true, indeterminate visual state takes precedence over checked/unchecked.

attributes.name: invalid
attributes.description: Whether the checkbox is invalid.

description.value: A component that is similar to <market-button>, but specifies a selected state for the user to 'choose' a specific button. The component also has the ability to be disabled and to have size changes. If necessary, secondary-text can be slotted to the right of the main label.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Functionally and visually disables the choice button

attributes.name: selected
attributes.description: Whether or not the choice button is in a selected state

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: String for setting choice button size

description.value:
market-code-display allows users to copy a displayed code to their clipboard for authentication purposes.

**Guidelines for use:**
- Out of the 3 slots, only 'code' is required.
- Slots must be used in order of 'code' => 'copy-text' => 'actions'. If not put in order, styling may break.
- Consumers can slot in up to 1 additional action on top of 'Copy' in the form of a \<button\> or \<a\> tag.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Whether the component should appear in a disabled state.

attributes.name: focused
attributes.description: A boolean representing whether the code input is focused or not.

description.value: A code-input component.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description:
A boolean representing whether the input is disabled or not.
This visually and functionally will disable the input.

attributes.name: focused
attributes.description: A boolean representing whether the code input is focused or not.

attributes.name: invalid
attributes.description:
A boolean representing whether the input is invalid or not.
This represents error states.

attributes.name: length
attributes.description: A number specifying the length of the code

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: A string specifying a name for the code input.

attributes.name: readonly
attributes.description: A boolean representing whether the input is readonly or not.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: A string specifying the type of input to render (text or numeric)

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: A string representing a default value (code) that can be passed in to be rendered

description.value: > **NOTE:** This component is currently in beta and its usage is subject to change before its release in a future major version of Market.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: Value representing the color shown on the color picker.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description:
Value representing the selected color of the secondary gradient picker.
This is a string that can represent a [CSS color value](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/color).
This is the value the color picker will use.
Supported color types are rgb/a, hsl/a, and hex colors.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description:
Value representing the color shown on the input.
This should be in a hexadecimal format (i.e. #ABC123), similarly to native HTML color inputs.

attributes.name: selected
attributes.description: Whether the swatch is selected or not.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: Value representing the color of the swatch. This is a string that can represent any [CSS color value](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/color).

attributes.name: value
attributes.description:
A string specifying a value for the list.
For a color swatch to be selected, this value should match the swatch's value.
Note: all color swatch values slotted in must be **unique**!
An empty string, or '', will clear the selection.

description.value:
`<market-content-card>` is a simple card component for displaying static content.
For interactive/selectable cards, see `market-action-card`.

attributes.name: animation-enter-duration
attributes.description: The duration for the modal enter animation, set from design tokens

attributes.name: animation-exit-duration
attributes.description: The duration for the modal exit animation, set from design tokens

attributes.name: hidden
attributes.description: Whether the context is hidden or visible.

attributes.name: active
attributes.description: Whether or not the context manager is UI blocking

description.value:
<market-banner>If you don't need a calendar UI and simply want a formatted input where a user can type a date, use `<market-input-text type="date">`.</market-banner>

You can use `<market-date-picker>` with `<market-button-dropdown>` or `<market-dropdown>` with the following in mind:

- Set `interaction="persistent"` to make the popover stay open while interacting with the date picker.
- Set `max-width: none` on the popover to make it wide enough to fit the menu sidebar.
- You will need to wire up your own event listeners to handle changes to the date value and close the dropdown.

An officially blessed, out-of-the-box date picker dropdown component to handle these types of issues is still under consideration.

attributes.name: display-menu
attributes.description:
Whether or not the side market-date-picker-menu is shown.
To pass in translation supported text, use slots available for each option.

attributes.name: displayed-date
attributes.description:
The ISO formatted string that determines the displayed month on the calendar.
Use DateTime string format as seen here: https://tc39.es/ecma262/#sec-date-time-string-format
Example: `YYYY-MM-DDT08:00`.
Note: Omitting the time portion defaults to UTC, so this may display as a day behind on your calendar!
If you add hours it will default to your timezone, like the above example.
Invalid date strings default to today's date.

attributes.name: exclude-menu-items
attributes.description:
A list of market-date-picker-menu items that will be excluded from appearing on the menu list.
i.e. `this-year,last-year` or `today,this-week,last-week,custom`
The menu names are lowercase and hyphenated strings, found here:
https://github.com/squareup/market/blob/main/web/web-components/src/components/market-date-picker/enums/menu.tsx

This works in conjunction with timeframe,
i.e. "timeframe=past", excludes dates in the future in addition to the ones here.
This is written as items separated by ','.

attributes.name: invalid
attributes.description:
Whether the selected dates are invalid.
It should not be possible to click on invalid dates, so this occurs through date inputs.

attributes.name: locale
attributes.description: Date picker locale. Defaults to browser locale. If that cannot be determined, defaults to 'en-US'.

attributes.name: mobile-menu-position
attributes.description: Position of menu on a mobile screen, if market-date-picker-menu is shown.

attributes.name: preset-menu-option
attributes.description:
Preset menu option to populate date picker range.
Presetting `custom` should be used with `selectedStartDate` and `selectedEndDate` props.
Otherwise if both `selectedStartDate/selectedEndDate` and `presetMenuOption` are given, `presetMenuOption` takes precedence.

attributes.name: selected-end-date
attributes.description:
User selected end date for a range saved as an ISO formatted string.
Use DateTime string format as seen here: https://tc39.es/ecma262/#sec-date-time-string-format
Example: `YYYY-MM-DDT08:00`.

attributes.name: selected-start-date
attributes.description:
User selected single date or start date for a range saved as an ISO formatted string.
Use DateTime string format as seen here: https://tc39.es/ecma262/#sec-date-time-string-format
Example: `YYYY-MM-DDT08:00`.

attributes.name: selection-type
attributes.description: Whether the date picker allows selection of a single date or a date range

attributes.name: timeframe
attributes.description:
String for setting timeframe type to select which market-date-picker-menu items to show.
Past means only past dates available, future is only current and future dates, and present is the default for all shown.

attributes.name: with-inputs
attributes.description: This enables the input field for the date picker.

attributes.name: year-view-active
attributes.description:
Displays a clickable caret in the month/year header.
If it is up, we show the month/year selection view instead of dates.

attributes.name: day
attributes.description: String for user to pass in value of the date

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Functionally and visually disables the date picker date

attributes.name: selected
attributes.description: Handles whether or not date picker date is selected

attributes.name: selection
attributes.description: String for setting date picker date selection type

attributes.name: today
attributes.description: Handles whether or not date picker date is for today's date

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: String type to determine type of date selected for parent component

attributes.name: range
attributes.description: Whether the date picker is a range

attributes.name: selected-end-date
attributes.description: The selected end date

attributes.name: selected-start-date
attributes.description: The selected start date

attributes.name: timeframe
attributes.description: The timeframe to restrict the date picker to

attributes.name: with-time
attributes.description: Whether to use date-time input instead of date-only

description.value: This component is a subcomponent of `market-date-picker`. It is not meant to be used as a standalone component. The purpose of these docs are to show that the menu row text items can be changed using the associated slots to support translation.

attributes.name: exclude-menu-items
attributes.description:
A list of menu items that will be excluded from appearing on the menu list.
i.e. `this-year,last-year` or `today,this-week,last-week,custom`
The menu names are lowercase and hyphenated strings, found here:
https://github.com/squareup/market/blob/main/web/web-components/src/components/market-date-picker/enums/menu.tsx

This works in conjunction with timeframe,
i.e. "timeframe=past", excludes dates in the future in addition to the ones here.
This is written as items separated by ','.

attributes.name: preset-menu-option
attributes.description: Preset menu option passed from the parent. For the menu, this handles visually selecting the menu row.

attributes.name: timeframe
attributes.description: String for setting timeframe type to select which menu items to show

attributes.name: animation-enter-duration
attributes.description: The duration for the modal enter animation, set from design tokens

attributes.name: animation-exit-duration
attributes.description: The duration for the modal exit animation, set from design tokens

attributes.name: data-dialog-id
attributes.description: INTERNAL ONLY: Used by the context manager to identify a specific dialog/modal

attributes.name: hidden
attributes.description: INTERNAL ONLY: Used in CSS to trigger start and stop animations

attributes.name: data-dialog-index
attributes.description:
INTERNAL ONLY: Used by the context manager to identify a specific dialog/modal's place
in the stack

attributes.name: is-loading
attributes.description: Whether the activity indicator is rendered or not

attributes.name: persistent
attributes.description: Whether the dialog is persistent or dismissable

attributes.name: trap-focus
attributes.description: Enforces focus trapping on the dialog

description.value: `<market-divider>` is used to separate two components with a configurable amount of space.

attributes.name: margin
attributes.description: Sets the vertical margin for the divider.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: Sets the vertical margin for the divider.

description.value:
A component with a "trigger" and a "content" slot. Interacting with the slotted trigger content will open the slotted content in a `<market-popover>` which is positioned using Popper.js. This component is used as the foundation for `<market-tooltip>` and `<market-button-dropdown>`.

We do not recommend using this component directly unless you have a design-approved use case that isn't covered by other available Market components!

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description:
Functionally disables the component, as well as relevant Market components
in the "trigger" slot (`<market-button>`, `<market-link>`).

attributes.name: expanded
attributes.description: Determines whether the dropdown is expanded or collapsed

attributes.name: interaction
attributes.description:
Defining how the popover should be triggered to open/close. Note that
clicks outside the dropdown will always close it.

`click`: popover toggles open/closed on clicks to the trigger or popover

`hover`: popover opens on trigger mouseover, closes on trigger or popover
 mouseout

`persistent`: popover toggles open/closed on clicks to the trigger, popover
stays open if users click on it or its content

`none`: popover does not toggle open/closed on any user interaction; it is
expected to be controlled by the parent component

attributes.name: popover-distance
attributes.description:
Configuration option for Popper.js (used to position `<market-popover>`).
Displaces the popper away from, or toward, the reference element in the
direction of its placement.
https://popper.js.org/docs/v2/modifiers/offset/#distance-1

attributes.name: popover-placement
attributes.description:
Configuration option for Popper.js (used to position `<market-popover>`).
Describes the preferred placement of the popper.
https://popper.js.org/docs/v2/constructors//#placement

attributes.name: popover-skidding
attributes.description:
Configuration option for Popper.js (used to position `<market-popover>`).
Displaces the popover along the reference element.
https://popper.js.org/docs/v2/modifiers/offset/#skidding-1

attributes.name: popover-strategy
attributes.description:
Configuration option for Popper.js (used to position `<market-popover>`).
Describes the positioning strategy to use. By default, it is absolute. If
your reference element is in a fixed container, use the fixed strategy.
https://popper.js.org/docs/v2/constructors//#strategy

description.value: A component that conveys an empty section or page.
A wrapper for form inputs. <market-field> handles functionality that lies outside the input itself.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description:
A boolean representing whether the field is disabled or not.
This visually and functionally will disable the field.

attributes.name: invalid
attributes.description:
A boolean representing whether the field is invalid or not.
This represents error states.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: A string specifying a name for the field.

attributes.name: readonly
attributes.description: A boolean representing whether the field is readonly or not.

description.value:
`market-file-upload` allows the user to choose one or more files from their device storage to add to its internal
`<input type="file">` element. **The component does not handle uploading the chosen files!** We recommend handling file
upload (or any other file operations) via an event listener on the `marketFileUploadValueChange` event, which is emitted
every time the selected file(s) are changed.

attributes.name: accept
attributes.description:
String that is a list of file types the uploader should accept. This is
passed to the internal `<input type="file"/>` tag. For more info, see the
[MDN docs](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/input/file#accept).

attributes.name: compact
attributes.description: Used to toggle "compact mode" (for use on mobile devices and when space is limited)

attributes.name: delete-button-aria-label
attributes.description:
Optional property passed to the delete icons on selected file
rows that will function as its aria-label. Defaults to "Delete".

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Functionally and visually disables the file picker.

attributes.name: file-subtext
attributes.description: What type of secondary information, if any, to display on all file rows

attributes.name: invalid
attributes.description:
DEPRECATED: Represents whether the input is invalid or not. This represents input-level error states.
We recommend using the fileMetadata prop to set error status and messages on the file level instead.

attributes.name: multiple
attributes.description:
Represents whether the selector allows multiple files
to be selected.

description.value:
> **NOTE:** This component is currently in beta and its usage is subject to change.

This component uses `<market-filter-button>` to display the label and selected value, and acts as the trigger for displaying the popover. The display value can be overwritten by adding an element with a `display-value` slot.

The popover can contain a `<market-list>` by assigning it with the `list` slot. When the list's `multiselect` is enabled, the popover will act as `interaction="persistent"`, unless explicitly set via the `dropdownInteraction` prop. Also with `multiselect`, it is recommended that the `<market-row>`s have a `<market-checkbox slot="control">`.

By default, the selected value is displayed next to the label. But for `<market-list multiselect>`, if there are multiple selections, the count is displayed instead. If you wish to give more detail to the count (e.g. "3 colors"), you may do so by utilizing the `display-value` slot.

Soon to be implemented is support for `<market-date-picker>`.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Functionally and visually disables the filter button

attributes.name: dropdown-interaction
attributes.description:
Defines what types of interaction the dropdown should have
(see `market-dropdown` docs for more granular explanation).

If not defined and the list is multiselect,
the dropdown interaction will be set to `persistent`
so that the dropdown won't automatically close after selecting a row.

attributes.name: expanded
attributes.description: Determines whether the filter is expanded or collapsed

attributes.name: focused
attributes.description: Whether or not the button is focused

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Filter name

attributes.name: popover-placement
attributes.description:
Configuration option for Popper.js (used to position `<market-popover>`).
Describes the positioning strategy to use. By default, it is `bottom-start`.
https://popper.js.org/docs/v2/constructors/#strategy

attributes.name: popover-strategy
attributes.description:
Configuration option for Popper.js (used to position `<market-popover>`).
Describes the positioning strategy to use. By default, it is absolute. If
your reference element is in a fixed container, use the fixed strategy.
https://popper.js.org/docs/v2/constructors//#strategy

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: String for setting filter button size

attributes.name: active
attributes.description: Whether or not the button is in an active state, e.g. filter is selected and dropdown is opened

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Functionally and visually disables the button

attributes.name: focused
attributes.description: Whether or not the button is focused

attributes.name: icon-only
attributes.description: Whether to display icon in place of label

attributes.name: popover-id
attributes.description: The ID of the popover element that the button controls

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: String for setting filter button size

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: String for setting filter button size

description.value:
> **NOTE:** This component is currently in beta and its usage is subject to change.

This serves as a container for `<market-input-search>` and `<market-filter>` and it handles layout variations depending on certain conditions such as the viewport width, number of filters, presence of search input, etc. as further described below.

An overflow menu for filters is automatically added when there's insufficient space or when there are more than 3 filters. In any case, filter group elements are not line wrapped. The overflowed filters are moved to the dropdown menu, where their respective value selection would be situated in that same dropdown. The size of the dropdown menu button is determined by the size of the first filter and it is assumed that all filters have the same size.

The search input, if provided, automatically transforms into compact mode on mobile viewports or when there are more than 3 filters in the group. When the search input is in compact mode and focus is given (by clicking it, for example), the search input component expands to show its input field and **all** filters are temporarily moved to the overflow menu. Removing the focus (by clicking the back button or anything else but the input) brings the search input back to compact mode.

There is no limit to the number of filters. Though having multiple search inputs may work, it will cause visual bugs and is therefore inadvisable.

attributes.name: max-visible-filters
attributes.description:
Maximum number of visible filters before they are truncated and moved into the overflow menu.
However, filters may be truncated anyway if there is not enough space.

description.value: A component for the bottom of a page or component, like <market-dialog>, <market-modal-partial>, or <market-modal-full>.
A component for the top of a page or component like <market-modal>.

attributes.name: close-button-aria-label
attributes.description: String to use for the aria-label accessibility attribute of the default close "x" button.

attributes.name: compact
attributes.description:
Whether or not the header is in compact mode
when navigation is present.

attributes.name: disable-close-button
attributes.description: Disables the default close "x" button.

attributes.name: show-navigation
attributes.description: Whether or not the navigation slot is shown

attributes.name: fidelity
attributes.description: Optional: A number representing the fidelity of the icon to display.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description:
A string identifier for the icon. This can be either the semantic name which maps to
a token or the descriptive name, which maps to a SVG id in the sprite, though using the
semantic name is preferred because it gives you access to additional features like fidelity.
You can also pass any string and it will display a symbol or group within any SVG sprite
on the page, whether it is the Market sprite or not.

description.value: A text input that masks the inputted text. There is a clickable icon that toggles the masking on and off.

attributes.name: autocomplete
attributes.description:
Whether or not this input should allow autocompletion by the browser
Accepts a boolean, or "true", "false", "on", "off" or an
[accepted string value for the autocomplete attribute](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/autocomplete)

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description:
A boolean representing whether the input is disabled or not.
This visually and functionally will disable the input.

attributes.name: focused
attributes.description: A boolean representing whether the input is focused or not.

attributes.name: input-id
attributes.description: A string specifying an ID for the input.

attributes.name: inputmode
attributes.description:
Allows a browser to display an appropriate virtual keyboard.
[Accepted values](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Global_attributes/inputmode).

attributes.name: invalid
attributes.description:
A boolean representing whether the input is invalid or not.
This represents error states.

attributes.name: maxlength
attributes.description: A number specifying the maximum length of characters for the input value.

attributes.name: minlength
attributes.description: A number specifying the minimum length of characters for the input value.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: A string specifying a name for the input.

attributes.name: placeholder
attributes.description:
A string specifying the placeholder of the input.
This is shown before a user attempts to add a value, given no value is already provided.

attributes.name: readonly
attributes.description: A boolean representing whether the input is readonly or not.

attributes.name: required
attributes.description:
Whether or not the input is required; used to validate the input's value.
See MDN on the [required attribute](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/required)

attributes.name: size
attributes.description:
String for setting input size.
Sizes `small` and `medium` visually hide the label,
but you should still provide one for accessibility purposes.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: A string specifying a value for the input. This will be visually shown on the input and can be edited by the user.

attributes.name: autocomplete
autofocus
attributes.description: A boolean representing whether the input should focus on page load

attributes.name: clear-button-aria-label
attributes.description: A string representing the clear button's aria-label; localize as needed

attributes.name: compact
attributes.description:
**INTERNAL [do not use directly]**

Used by `market-filter-group` when setting this component to compact mode

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description:
A boolean representing whether the input is disabled or not;
this visually and functionally will disable the input.

attributes.name: focused
attributes.description: A boolean representing whether the input is focused or not

attributes.name: input-aria-label
attributes.description: A string representing the input's aria-label; localize as needed

attributes.name: maxlength
attributes.description: A number specifying the maximum length of characters for the input value

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: A string specifying a name for the search input

attributes.name: placeholder
attributes.description:
A string specifying the placeholder of the input;
this is shown before a user attempts to add a value, given no value is already provided.

attributes.name: search-icon-button-aria-label
attributes.description: A string representing the search icon button's aria-label; localize as needed

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: A string specifying the size of the input

attributes.name: value
attributes.description:
A string specifying a value for the input;
this will be visually shown on the input and can be edited by the user.

attributes.name: autocomplete
attributes.description:
Whether or not this input should allow autocompletion by the browser
Accepts a boolean, or "true", "false", "on", "off" or an
[accepted string value for the autocomplete attribute](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/autocomplete)

attributes.name: autofilled
attributes.description:
Whether the input is displaying an initial autofill value. Used for
styling to ensure the label floats up correctly.

attributes.name: autofocus
attributes.description:
A boolean representing whether the input should focus on page load.
If multiple elements with `autofocus` are present, it is not guaranteed which one
will ultimately receive the focus. It is advised that only one at most is present.

attributes.name: autovalidate
attributes.description:
Whether or not to automatically style this input as invalid based on
native input validation attributes: `min`, `max`, `pattern`, `required`, `maxlength`, `minlength`.
See MDN articles on [form validation](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/Forms/Form_validation)
and [constraint validation](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Constraint_validation)

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description:
A boolean representing whether the input is disabled or not.
This visually and functionally will disable the input.

attributes.name: focused
attributes.description: A boolean representing whether the input is focused or not.

attributes.name: input-id
attributes.description: A string specifying an ID for the input.

attributes.name: inputmode
attributes.description:
Allows a browser to display an appropriate virtual keyboard.
[Accepted values](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Global_attributes/inputmode).

attributes.name: invalid
attributes.description:
A boolean representing whether the input is invalid or not.
This represents error states.

attributes.name: max
attributes.description:
Specifies the maximum value for number and time inputs.
See MDN on the [max attribute](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/max)

attributes.name: maxlength
attributes.description:
A number specifying the maximum length of characters for the input value.
See MDN on the [maxlength attribute](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/maxlength)

attributes.name: min
attributes.description:
Specifies the minimum value for number and time inputs.
See MDN on the [min attribute](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/min)

attributes.name: minlength
attributes.description:
A number specifying the minimum length of characters for the input value.
See MDN on the [minlength attribute](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/minlength)

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: A string specifying a name for the input.

attributes.name: pattern
attributes.description:
Specifies a [regular expression](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Guide/Regular_expressions)
to validate the input's value against.
See MDN on the [pattern attribute](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/pattern)

attributes.name: placeholder
attributes.description:
A string specifying the placeholder of the input.
This is shown before a user attempts to add a value, given no value is already provided.

attributes.name: readonly
attributes.description: A boolean representing whether the input is readonly or not.

attributes.name: required
attributes.description:
Whether or not the input is required; used to validate the input's value.
See MDN on the [required attribute](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/required)

attributes.name: size
attributes.description:
String for setting input size.
Sizes `small` and `medium` visually hide the label,
but you should still provide one for accessibility purposes.

attributes.name: step
attributes.description:
Specifies the increment step for number and time inputs.
See MDN on the [step attribute](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/step)

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: A string specifying the type of control to render. Any native HTML input type would work here.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: A string specifying a value for the input. This will be visually shown on the input and can be edited by the user.

description.value: A simple styled link component.

attributes.name: destructive
attributes.description: Gives the link destructive styling.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Visually disables the link and prevents navigating to the link on click.

attributes.name: download
attributes.description:
Causes the browser to treat the linked URL as a download. Only works for same-origin URLs.
Only applies when an `href` is provided.
See [here](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/a#download) for details on accepted values.

attributes.name: highlight
attributes.description: Links that exist within a larger block of text need to rely on more than color to meet accessibility standards.

attributes.name: href
attributes.description:
String that represents the URL the link goes to.
If not present, the internal tag will be a `<button>` rather than `<a>` in order to align with a11y best practices.

attributes.name: rel
attributes.description:
Defines the relationship between a linked resource and the current document.
Only applies when an `href` is provided.
See [here](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/rel) for details on accepted values.

attributes.name: target
attributes.description:
Specifies where to open the linked URL.
See [here](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/a#attr-target) for details on accepted values.

description.value:
A component for displaying lists of items.

You can slot `<market-row>` or `<market-action-card>` into `<market-list>`. If
the list is `interactive`, it will handle selection/deselection of its slotted
rows or cards.

`<market-list>` and `<market-row>` can be used together in `<market-select>`'s
`list` slot and will function in that context as an interactive list of options.

attributes.name: filter-strategy
attributes.description:
Filter strategy

- `"textcontent"` (default, case-insensitive): This strategy searches through each of the rows `.textContent`. This means it would also search through a rows subtext, accessories, and other slots.
- `"label"` (case-insensitive): This strategy searches through the slotted `<label>` elements of rows. Note that if a `<label>` is not slotted in a row, this default filter strategy will not work.
- `"value"` (case-sensitive): This strategy searches through the rows `value` attribute. Values are usually case-sensitive so they are treated the same way when searching for them.
- `Function`: This strategy works similarly to `Array.prototype.filter()` where the functions `boolean` output determines if the item will be kept or filtered out. For your convenience, you are provided with 5 parameters:
  - `item`: `TMarketListItem`
  - `label`: the `<label>`s `.textContent`
  - `query`: `value` of `<market-input-search>`
  - `textContent`: the items `.textContent`
  - `value`: `value` of the item

attributes.name: hide-selectable-count
attributes.description: Whether a count of selectable items rendered within the control row will be hidden

attributes.name: interactive
attributes.description:
Whether or not the list is interactive. Results in list items receiving hover and active styling when hovered/clicked.
_NOTE:_ Lists slotted into `market-popover`, or any of the components that use it internally such as `market-select`, `market-dropdown`, and `market-button-dropdown`, will automatically have their `interactive` property set to `true`.

attributes.name: multiselect
attributes.description:
Whether or not the list can allow for multiple selections (currently not
reflected in the `value` prop)

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: String value used for the `aria-labelledby` attribute.

attributes.name: reorder-mode
attributes.description:
When set to `framework`, the list will move the reordered row back to its original position
before the `marketListItemsReordered` event is fired. This is useful when the list
is rendered within a framework like Ember or React.

attributes.name: reorderable
attributes.description:
Whether the list is reorderable or not.
Setting to `internal` enables reordering rows internally
while `external` also allows dragging to & from other lists.

attributes.name: transient
attributes.description: When set to `true`, rows/cards will not persist selected state on click. Only takes effect when `interactive` is true.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description:
A string specifying a value for the list. To select multiple values,
separate **unique** values with a comma (e.g. `'orange,pear'`).
Setting to empty string (`''`) will clear all current selections.

description.value:
Note: Dialogs/Modals in Market are "dumb" components and are mostly only concerned with how
they look on the page. They don't know anything about closing & opening or even
how they are positioned on the page. Those things are handled by the context and
context manager.

attributes.name: animation-enter-duration
attributes.description: The duration for the modal enter animation, set from design tokens

attributes.name: animation-exit-duration
attributes.description: The duration for the modal exit animation, set from design tokens

attributes.name: data-dialog-id
attributes.description: INTERNAL ONLY: Used by the context manager to identify a specific dialog/modal

attributes.name: hidden
attributes.description: INTERNAL ONLY: Used in CSS to trigger start and stop animations

attributes.name: data-dialog-index
attributes.description:
INTERNAL ONLY: Used by the context manager to identify a specific dialog/modal's place
in the stack

attributes.name: layout
attributes.description:
Sets the layout width for the main content area. Defaults to `regular`, which sets a
a maximum content width of 600px. You can also use `wide` for a max 1248px content area,
or `fluid` to have content fill the whole viewport.

attributes.name: trap-focus
attributes.description: Enforces focus trapping on the modal

description.value:
Note: Dialogs/Modals in Market are "dumb" components and are mostly only concerned with how
they look on the page. They don't know anything about closing & opening or even
how they are positioned on the page. Those things are handled by the context and
context manager.

attributes.name: animation-enter-duration
attributes.description: The duration for the modal enter animation, set from design tokens

attributes.name: animation-exit-duration
attributes.description: The duration for the modal exit animation, set from design tokens

attributes.name: data-dialog-id
attributes.description: INTERNAL ONLY: Used by the context manager to identify a specific dialog/modal

attributes.name: hidden
attributes.description: INTERNAL ONLY: Used in CSS to trigger start and stop animations

attributes.name: data-dialog-index
attributes.description:
INTERNAL ONLY: Used by the context manager to identify a specific dialog/modal's place
in the stack

attributes.name: trap-focus
attributes.description: Enforces focus trapping on the modal

description.value:
A component to use for pagination. Renders two subcomponents: `<market-pagination-page-size>`, a dropdown for selecting the page size (number of items per page), and `<market-pagination-nav>`, a dropdown for selecting a specific page, and buttons for navigating to the previous/next pages. The previous button will be disabled if the current page is the first page, and the next button will be disabled if the current page is the last page.

This component does not handle actually rendering any paginated items, nor does it implement any kind of navigation on its own. It emits the following events in response to user interaction, which should be listened to and implemented by the client application:

- `marketPaginationPageSizeChange` - emits `{ pageSize }`
- `marketPaginationNavigation` - emits `{ page, prevPage, pageSize }`

_That means when interacting with the Storybook examples, the selected value in the dropdowns will not change. You can inspect the Actions pane of the story to view the emitted event details._

attributes.name: current-page
attributes.description: The current page being viewed.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Functionally and visually disables all navigation buttons

attributes.name: has-next-page
attributes.description: Allow the user to navigate to the next page

attributes.name: has-previous-page
attributes.description: Allow the user to navigate to the previous page

attributes.name: page-size
attributes.description: The number of results displayed per page.

attributes.name: page-size-options
attributes.description: Options for page sizes (comma separated list of numbers). If omitted, will not display the page size subcomponent.

attributes.name: total-pages
attributes.description: The total number of pages.

attributes.name: current-page
attributes.description: The current page being viewed.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Functionally and visually disables the navigation buttons

attributes.name: has-next-page
attributes.description: Allow the user to navigate to the next page

attributes.name: has-previous-page
attributes.description: Allow the user to navigate to the previous page

attributes.name: page-size
attributes.description:
The number of results displayed per page.
Required to emit this value as part of the navigation event.

attributes.name: total-pages
attributes.description: The total number of pages.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Functionally and visually disables dropdown

attributes.name: page-size-options
attributes.description: Options for page sizes (comma separated list).

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The number of results displayed per page.

attributes.name: indicator
attributes.description: Controls whether the pill should display an indicator icon.

attributes.name: interactive
attributes.description: Controls whether the pill should react to hovers/clicks. It is recommended to only set this to true if you have also slotted an icon into the pill.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: String for setting pill size

attributes.name: variant
attributes.description: Sets the visual variant style for the pill.

description.value: A simple component used by other components like `<market-select>` and `<market-dropdown>` to display popovers.

attributes.name: compact
attributes.description:
Whether the progress tracker is in compact mode

Only functional when `orientation` is set to `"horizontal"`

attributes.name: connectorless
attributes.description: Whether there are connectors displayed between steps

attributes.name: current-step-index
attributes.description:
Index of the current step of the tracker

When defined, the child `market-progress-tracker-step` components
`active` and `completed` attributes will be automatically set.

Otherwise, it is expected that the steps
`active` and `completed` properties are manually set.

attributes.name: indicator
attributes.description: Type of icon used to indicate the steps progress

attributes.name: interactive
attributes.description:
Whether this step tracker is interactive

Only functional when `orientation` is set to `"horizontal"`

attributes.name: orientation
attributes.description: Progress tracker orientation

attributes.name: reversed
attributes.description: Whether the direction of the progress indicators is reversed

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: Steps size

attributes.name: active
attributes.description: Whether the step is active

attributes.name: completed
attributes.description: Whether the step is completed

attributes.name: name
attributes.description:
Unique name of the step

When this step is interactive and clicked, it is included in the detail of the emitted event.

attributes.name: border
attributes.description:
Include a six data-pixel border around the QR code. When this attribute is
present, the QR code will have a background color (default is transparent
background).

attributes.name: content
attributes.description:
The URL or other content of the QR code. The QR code is generated using
[@square/qrcode-encoder](https://github.com/squareup/qrcode/blob/master/packages/square-qrcode-encoder/README.md).

attributes.name: monochrome
attributes.description: When true, QR code will render all elements in black & white.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description:
By default, QR code size is dependent on the information being encoded.
Use this property to set the QR code's height and width in pixels.

description.value:
`<market-radio>` can be used on its own, or slotted into `<market-row>` as a control. When used with `market-row`, the
row's `selected` prop overrides the radio's `selected` prop.

attributes.name: active
attributes.description: Whether the radio is active or not.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Whether the radio button is disabled.

attributes.name: focused
attributes.description: Whether the radio is focused or not.

attributes.name: hovered
attributes.description: Whether the radio is hovered or not.

attributes.name: invalid
attributes.description: Whether the radio button is invalid.

attributes.name: selected
attributes.description:
Whether the radio button is selected (analogous to the HTML input attribute `checked`).
If used as a slotted control inside of `market-row`, this will be overridden by the row's `selected` property.

attributes.name: control-position
attributes.description: Whether the slotted control appears to the left or right of the main content.

attributes.name: destructive
attributes.description: Gives the row destructive styling.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description:
Whether the row is disabled.
Also disables slotted controls (`<market-checkbox>`, `<market-radio>`, or `<market-toggle>`), if present.

attributes.name: drag-enabled
attributes.description: Whether the row is drag & drop enabled

attributes.name: drag-handle-position
attributes.description: Whether the drag handle appears to the left or right.

attributes.name: href
attributes.description:
A link that this row should navigate to on click.
If this property is set, an anchor tag will be rendered.

attributes.name: interactive
attributes.description:
Whether or not the row is interactive. Results in rows receiving hover and active styling when hovered/clicked. Automatically set to `true` when using the drill variant or passing in a slotted control (checkbox/radio/toggle).
Automatically be set to reflect the list's `interactive` value if used inside of ``.

attributes.name: selected
attributes.description:
Whether the row is currently selected. Used by `<market-list>` and `<market-select>`.
Also sets the selection state for slotted controls (`<market-checkbox>`, `<market-radio>`, or `<market-toggle>`),
if present.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: Determines the form factor of the row.

attributes.name: target
attributes.description:
Specifies where to display the linked URL.
Only applies when an `href` is provided.
See [here](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/a#attr-target) for details on accepted values.

attributes.name: togglable
attributes.description:
By default, row selection is toggled on click. There are some cases, such
as selects, where we instead want the row to stay active on subsequent
clicks. Setting `togglable` to `false` enables this behavior. Can be set
by `<market-list>` and `<market-select>`.

attributes.name: transient
attributes.description:
When set to `true`, rows will not persist selected state on click.
Only takes effect when `interactive` is true.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The value for the row.

attributes.name: variant
attributes.description:
The style of row you want to use. The default is "regular", which allows
you to optionally slot a checkbox, radio, or (in the future) toggle control.
The other option is "drill", which functions more like a link that you can
use to drill through a series of action card sets.

description.value: This component is a subcomponent of `market-segmented-control`. It is not meant to be used as a standalone component.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Whether the market segment should appear in a disabled state.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: A string specifying a value for the segment.

description.value: Segmented controls are commonly used to provide a second level of navigation to display different views. They can also be used to filter a collection. Intended for use with `market-segment`.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description:
A boolean representing whether the market-segmented-control is disabled or not.
This visually and functionally will disable the control area.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description:
A string specifying a value for the segmented-control.
This value determines which segment is selected based on the segment value.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Functionally and visually disables the select.

attributes.name: focused
attributes.description: Whether or not the select is focused.

attributes.name: invalid
attributes.description: Whether or not the select is invalid (w/ corresponding visual state)

attributes.name: multiselect
attributes.description: Whether or not multiselect is enabled

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: String for the "name" attribute. Used when slotted into `market-field`.

attributes.name: placeholder
attributes.description:
A string specifying the placeholder for the select.
This is shown when the select is open with no selection.

attributes.name: popover-container
attributes.description:
Ancestor selector to contain the popover menu.
Use this if you need the popover to be appended to
an ancestor element other than the `body` element.

attributes.name: popover-strategy
attributes.description:
Configuration option for Floating UI (used to position `<market-popover>`).
Describes the positioning strategy to use. By default, it is absolute. If
your reference element is in a fixed container, use the fixed strategy.
https://floating-ui.com/docs/computePosition#strategy

attributes.name: readonly
attributes.description: Whether or not the select is readonly.

attributes.name: required
attributes.description:
Whether or not the select is required. This property relays
important contextual information when using a screen reader

attributes.name: size
attributes.description:
String for setting select size.
Sizes `small` and `medium` visually hide the label,
but you should still provide one for accessibility purposes.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description:
A string specifying a value for the select
Must correspond to a `value` attribute on a slotted `market-row`
For multiselect, separate values with a comma (e.g. 'orange,pear').

attributes.name: animation-enter-duration
attributes.description: The duration for the modal enter animation, set from design tokens

attributes.name: animation-exit-duration
attributes.description: The duration for the modal exit animation, set from design tokens

attributes.name: close-handle-aria-label
attributes.description: Translated string to label Close handle

attributes.name: disable-focus
attributes.description: Disable focus trapping on the modal

attributes.name: open-mode
attributes.description: Default state sheet opens to when opened from close

description.value: A number input that can be incremented and decremented using the + and - buttons.

attributes.name: decrement-aria-label
attributes.description: The decrement button's aria-label. Localize as needed.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description:
Whether the input is disabled or not.
This visually and functionally disables the input.

attributes.name: focused
attributes.description: Whether the input is focused or not.

attributes.name: increment-aria-label
attributes.description: The increment button's aria-label. Localize as needed.

attributes.name: input-aria-label
attributes.description: The inner input's aria-label. Localize as needed.

attributes.name: input-id
attributes.description: The ID for the inner input.

attributes.name: invalid
attributes.description: Whether the input is invalid or not. This represents error states.

attributes.name: max
attributes.description:
A number specifying the greatest value in the range of permitted values.
(See MDN on the [max attribute](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/input#max))

attributes.name: min
attributes.description:
A number specifying the most negative value in the range of permitted values.
(See MDN on the [min attribute](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/input#min))

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name for the inner input.

attributes.name: placeholder
attributes.description:
The placeholder of the input. Shown before a user attempts to
add a value, given no value is already provided.

attributes.name: readonly
attributes.description: Whether the input is readonly or not.

attributes.name: step
attributes.description:
A positive number specifying the increment step.
(See MDN on the [step attribute](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/input#step))

attributes.name: value
attributes.description:
The value for the input. This is visually shown on the input
and can be edited by the user.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Whether or not the tab is disabled

attributes.name: selected
attributes.description: Whether or not the tab is selected

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: Tab's size

attributes.name: default-tab
attributes.description:
String for the default selected tab (i.e. `market-tab`'s `id` attribute)

Only used when the component initially loads

attributes.name: selected-tab
attributes.description:
String for the selected tab (i.e. `market-tab`'s `id` attribute)

Omitting or setting to empty string will default to the first non-disabled tab

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: Tabs' size

attributes.name: hidden
attributes.description: Whether or not the panel is hidden

description.value:
Designed to be used with `market-table-row`, `market-table-column`, and `market-table-cell`.

In order to make a basic table, set up the markup as in this example:

```
<market-table>
  <market-table-row slot="header">
    <market-table-column name="column-1">Header content</market-table-column>
    <market-table-column name="column-2">Header content</market-table-column>
    <market-table-column name="column-3">Header content</market-table-column>
  </market-table-row>
  <market-table-row>
    <market-table-cell>Cell content</market-table-cell>
    <market-table-cell>Cell content</market-table-cell>
    <market-table-cell>Cell content</market-table-cell>
  </market-table-row>
</market-table>
```

`market-table` uses CSS grid for layout. By default it will use auto-flow the cells into equally-sized columns, but you can refine your table's column widths by using a `grid-template-columns` definition:

```css
.my-market-table {
  grid-template-columns: 100px 1fr 1fr;
}
```

In order to support custom column widths and sticky table columns, `market-table` will clip content that overflows the width of the table. If you are working on a table that needs to scroll horizontally, you can override this behavior by unsetting the `overflow-x` style:

```css
.my-market-table {
  overflow-x: unset; /* default is 'clip' */
}
```

This component is intended for internal use only! It is used by `market-table` to define areas for sticky rows (header/main/footer) and by `market-table-row` to define areas for sticky columns (left/main/right).

attributes.name: active
attributes.description: Whether or not this table area is currently visible/has any rows or cells within

attributes.name: orientation
attributes.description: Whether or not this area is grouping columns (vertical) or rows (horizontal)

attributes.name: stick-to
attributes.description: Sticks this area to an edge of the table

description.value:
Table cells are the most atomic component of a table. You can slot any kind of content into a cell.

When used in a `market-table`, table cells inherit properties from their parent `market-table-row`
and corresponding `market-table-column` (if one exists). It should be rare to have to set a prop on
`market-table-cell` directly.

Analogous to the `<td>` HTML element.

attributes.name: active
attributes.description: Whether the cell is currently active.

attributes.name: align
attributes.description:
Content/text alignment for this cell, default is set based on the alignment of the
market-table-column with matching column/name prop

**NOTE:** this is set automatically when used in a `market-table` with a corresponding
`market-table-column`.

attributes.name: column
attributes.description:
A key that matches the 'name' prop on the appropriate market-table-column

**NOTE:** this is set automatically when used in a `market-table` with a corresponding
`market-table-column`.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Whether the cell is disabled.

attributes.name: interactive
attributes.description:
Whether or not the cell is interactive. Results in cell receiving
hover and active styling when hovered/clicked.

attributes.name: leading-indentation
attributes.description:
Determines how much to indent the cell by.
This will be multiplied by the default indentation size (40px) for uniform indentation levels

**NOTE:** this is inherited automatically if set on the parent `market-table-row`.

description.value:
A `market-table-column` is a special type of table cell, intended for use in a `market-table-row`
and required for any row slotted into the `header` slot of `market-table`. It controls properties
for all cells in a column in addition to acting as a table heading for a column (similar to how a
`<th>` would).

You MUST pass a `[name]` attribute to every `market-table-column` element, as this is how it keeps
track of its related cells.

attributes.name: align
attributes.description: Will set the `align` property on all related cells to this value

attributes.name: hidden
attributes.description: Hides the column and all related cells.

attributes.name: index
attributes.description:
**INTERNAL [do not use directly]**
The order of this market-table-column in the DOM

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: **REQUIRED:** A unique key for this column, used to map all related cells together

attributes.name: sort-order
attributes.description:
What order the column is sorting in; ascending points up and descending points down
If the column is sortable and this prop is not present, the sort icon points up but is grayed out.

attributes.name: sortable
attributes.description: Whether or not this column is sortable

attributes.name: stick-to
attributes.description: Makes this column stick to an edge of the table

attributes.name: width
attributes.description:
**INTERNAL [do not use directly]**
Set by the parent table element, based on it's grid-template-columns CSS value

description.value:
`market-table-row` expects its slotted children to be `market-table-cell` or `market-table-column`
elements, and can be fixed ('stuck') to the top or bottom edge of its parent table.

Analogous to the `<tr>` HTML element.

attributes.name: active
attributes.description: Whether the row is currently active.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Whether the row is disabled.

attributes.name: expanded
attributes.description:
**INTERNAL [do not use directly]**
Used to set aria-expanded on the nested button for animation

attributes.name: footer
attributes.description: Gives this row footer styling

attributes.name: header
attributes.description: Gives this row header styling

attributes.name: index
attributes.description:
**INTERNAL [do not use directly]**
The order of this row in the DOM

attributes.name: interactive
attributes.description:
Whether or not the row is interactive. Results in row receiving
hover and active styling when hovered/clicked.

attributes.name: leading-indentation
attributes.description:
Optional: Level of leading indentation
This will be multiplied by the default indentation size (40px) for uniform indentation
levels

attributes.name: nested
attributes.description:
Used to determine if the table has accordion rows. When true,
it will add extra spacing at the beginning of the row. This will
keep the row's contents aligned with the accordion rows. This is
set from the market-table component.

This property can be overriden when the content does not need
the extra accordion spacing.

attributes.name: original-slot
attributes.description: The slot this row was originally placed in

attributes.name: selected
attributes.description: Whether the row is selected. Used by control element.

attributes.name: stick-to
attributes.description: Optional: The edge of the table to fix this row to.

attributes.name: sticky
attributes.description:
Optional: When present, can be used instead of `stickTo` in combination
with `header` or `footer` to determine the edge of the table to stick this
row to. (`header` elements with `[sticky]` will be attached to the top, and
`footer` elements to the bottom)

attributes.name: align
attributes.description:
Sets the horizontal alignment.
Table alignment will be inherited by descendant rows & cells.

attributes.name: collapsible
attributes.description: Whether the slotted table groups are collapsible.

attributes.name: layout
attributes.description:
Sets the `table-layout` algorithm.
By default, the column widths are adjusted to fit the content.
If column widths are explicitly sized, use `fixed` to speed up render time.
See [table-layout](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/table-layout)
for more information.

attributes.name: reorder-mode
attributes.description:
When set to `framework`, the table will move the reordered item back to its original position
before the `marketTableV2RowsReordered` event is fired. This is useful when the table
is rendered within a framework like Ember or React.

attributes.name: reorderable
attributes.description:
Whether the table is reorderable or not.
Setting to `internal` enables reordering table rows internally
while `external` also allows dragging to & from other tables.

attributes.name: selected
attributes.description:
Whether the table is selected.
Relevant if the table has rows with a slotted controls.

attributes.name: valign
attributes.description:
Sets the vertical alignment.
Table alignment will be inherited by descendant rows & cells.

attributes.name: active
attributes.description: Whether the cell is currently active.

attributes.name: align
attributes.description:
Sets the horizontal alignment. When not set,
alignment is inherited from an ancestor row or table.

attributes.name: caret
caret-aria-label-collapsed
attributes.description: Translated label for the expand action when group is currently collapsed (for screen reader users)

attributes.name: caret-aria-label-expanded
attributes.description: Translated label for the collapse action when group is currently expanded (for screen reader users)

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Whether the cell is currently disabled.

attributes.name: indent
attributes.description: Indentation level

attributes.name: interactive
attributes.description: Whether the cell is interactive, which results in hover, focus, & pressed styles.

attributes.name: nowrap
attributes.description:
Set this to `true` to force cell text onto one line.
May cause horizontal scrolling in the ancestor table.

attributes.name: selected
attributes.description:
Whether the cell is selected.
Relevant if the cell has a slotted control.

attributes.name: sort-aria-label-ascending
attributes.description: Translated label for the icon indicating an ascending sort (for screen reader users)

attributes.name: sort-aria-label-descending
attributes.description: Translated label for the icon indicating a descending sort (for screen reader users)

attributes.name: sort-aria-label-none
attributes.description: Translated label for the icon indicating no sort applied (for screen reader users)

attributes.name: sort-order
attributes.description:
When `sortable` is `true`, this prop sets the `aria-sort` attribute
and displays an arrow in the correct sort direction.

attributes.name: sort-strategy
attributes.description:
When `sortable` is `true`, this prop specifies the sorting strategy.
- `'string'`: sorts rows alphabetically (case-insensitive) by the text content of the cell (default)
- `'number'`: sorts rows numerically using [`parseFloat()`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/parseFloat) to parse the cell content
- `'datetime'`: sorts rows chronologically using [date-fns `parse()`](https://date-fns.org/v3.3.1/docs/parse) method to parse the cell content. This strategy requires specifying a format in the cell's `sortStrategyFormat` prop; see accepted formats [here](https://date-fns.org/v3.3.1/docs/parse)
- `Function`: a custom callback function to compare rows, similar to the `compareFn` in [`Array.sort()`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/sort). The following arguments are provided to the function:
  - `rowA`: the first row for comparison
  - `rowB`: the second row for comparison
  - `order`: the direction of the sort, either `ascending` or `descending`
  - `index`: the index of the column being sorted on

  The callback function should return a number whose sign indicates the relative order of the two elements:
  - negative if `rowA` is less than `rowB`
  - positive if `rowA` is greater than `rowB`
  - zero if `rowA` & `rowB` are equal

attributes.name: sort-strategy-format
attributes.description:
When setting `sortStrategy` to `"datetime"`, this prop is required to specify the format.
See accepted formats [here](https://date-fns.org/v3.3.1/docs/parse)

attributes.name: sortable
attributes.description: When the cell is in a table header row, this prop enables sorting by this cell's column.

attributes.name: sticky
attributes.description:
Makes a cell "stick" to the left or right of its parent row.
Requires the row to be sized wider than the table to enable horizontal scrolling.

attributes.name: valign
attributes.description:
Sets the vertical alignment. When not set,
alignment is inherited from an ancestor row or table.

attributes.name: collapsed
attributes.description: Whether the group is expanded or collapsed, when `collapsible` is `true`.

attributes.name: collapsible
attributes.description: Whether the group is collapsible.

attributes.name: drag-enabled
attributes.description: Whether the group is drag & drop enabled.

attributes.name: indent
attributes.description: Indentation level

attributes.name: reorder-mode
attributes.description:
When set to `framework`, the group will move the reordered item back to its original position
before the `marketTableV2RowsReordered` event is fired. This is useful when the table
is rendered within a framework like Ember or React.

attributes.name: reorderable
attributes.description:
Whether the group is reorderable or not.
Setting to `internal` enables reordering table rows internally
while `external` also allows dragging to & from other tables.

attributes.name: selected
attributes.description:
Whether the group is selected.
Relevant if the group has rows with slotted controls.

attributes.name: active
attributes.description: Whether the row is currently active.

attributes.name: align
attributes.description:
Sets the horizontal alignment.
When not set, alignment is inherited from an ancestor table.
Likewise, row alignment will be inherited by descendant cells.

attributes.name: caret
disabled
attributes.description: Whether the row is currently disabled.

attributes.name: drag-enabled
attributes.description: Whether the row is drag & drop enabled.

attributes.name: drag-handle-position
attributes.description: Whether the drag handle appears to the left or right.

attributes.name: drag-handle-visibility
attributes.description: Whether the drag handle appears always or only on hover

attributes.name: footer
attributes.description: Styles a row with footer styles.

attributes.name: header
attributes.description: Styles a row with header styles.

attributes.name: indent
attributes.description: Indentation level of the first cell in the row.

attributes.name: interactive
attributes.description: Whether the row is interactive, which results in hover, focus, & pressed styles.

attributes.name: selected
attributes.description:
Whether the row is selected.
Relevant if the row's first cell has a slotted control.

attributes.name: sticky
attributes.description:
Makes a row "stick" to the top or bottom of its parent table.
Requires an explict height on the table to enable vertical scrolling.

attributes.name: valign
attributes.description:
Sets the vertical alignment.
When not set, alignment is inherited from an ancestor table.
Likewise, row alignment will be inherited by descendant cells.

attributes.name: default-tab
attributes.description:
String for the default selected tab (i.e. `market-tab`'s `id` attribute)

Only used when the component initially loads

attributes.name: selected-tab
attributes.description:
String for the selected tab (i.e. `market-tab`'s `id` attribute)

Omitting or setting to empty string will default to the first non-disabled tab

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Functionally and visually disables the tag

attributes.name: focused
attributes.description: Whether or not the tag is in a focused state

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: String for setting tag size

description.value: A multi-line text input component.

attributes.name: autofocus
attributes.description:
A boolean representing whether the input should focus on page load.
If multiple elements with `autofocus` are present, it is not guaranteed which one
will ultimately receive the focus. It is advised that only one at most is present.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description:
A boolean representing whether the textarea is disabled or not.
This visually and functionally will disable the textarea.

attributes.name: focused
attributes.description: A boolean representing whether the textarea is focused or not.

attributes.name: inputmode
attributes.description:
Allows a browser to display an appropriate virtual keyboard.
[Accepted values](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Global_attributes/inputmode).

attributes.name: invalid
attributes.description:
A boolean representing whether the textarea is invalid or not.
This represents error states.

attributes.name: max-height
attributes.description:
A string specifying the maximum height in pixels for the textarea. Vertical resizing will be limited to this height. Example value: '200px'.

**DEPRECATED**: set `max-height` via CSS

attributes.name: maxlength
attributes.description: A string specifying the maximum length of characters for the input value.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: A string specifying a name for the textarea.

attributes.name: placeholder
attributes.description:
A string specifying the placeholder of the textarea.
This is shown before a user attempts to add a value, given no value is already provided.

attributes.name: readonly
attributes.description: A boolean representing whether the textarea is readonly or not.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: A string specifying a value for the textarea. This will be visually shown on the textarea and can be edited by the user.

attributes.name: aria-disabled
attributes.description: Whether to disable the tile.

attributes.name: interactive
attributes.description: Enables interactivity.

attributes.name: selected
attributes.description: Whether the tile is currently selected

attributes.name: show-actions
