attributes.description: Whether to render the markup in the action slot.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: What size tile to render.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: Value for the tile.

description.value:
Toasts are a small message that shows up in a box at the bottom of the screen and disappears on its own after few seconds. It is a simple feedback about an operation in which current activity remains visible and interactive. 

`market-toast` should be used together with [`market-toaster`](../market-toaster/readme.md)

attributes.name: dismiss-button-aria-label
attributes.description:
Optional property to pass a string to the dismiss "x"
that will function as its aria-label. Defaults to "Dismiss".

attributes.name: persistent
attributes.description: Whether or not the toast persists, ie does not autodismiss after 5s

attributes.name: progress
attributes.description: The progress of the action, progress bar will be rendered for values between 0-100 inclusive

attributes.name: variant
attributes.description: toast variant that corresponds to the type of info it is conveying

description.value: `market-toaster` is a container for `market-toast`. It handles showing `market-toast` for its alloted amount of time on the screen. It is also positioned to ensure that toasts appear on top of all other elements.

`<market-toggle>` can be used on its own, or slotted into `<market-row>` as a control. When used with `market-row`,
the row's `selected` prop overrides the toggle's `checked` prop.

attributes.name: active
attributes.description: Whether the toggle is active or not.

attributes.name: checked
attributes.description:
Whether the toggle is checked or not.
If used as a slotted control inside of `market-row`, this will be overridden by the row's `selected` property.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Whether the toggle is disabled.

attributes.name: focused
attributes.description: Whether the toggle is focused or not.

attributes.name: hovered
attributes.description: Whether the toggle is hovered or not.

description.value:
This component uses `<market-dropdown>` to create a component with a "trigger" slot (which expects text or an icon) and a "content" slot. Interacting with the text/icon trigger will open the slotted content in a tooltip-specific popover which is positioned using Popper.js.

To tweak the position of the tooltip popover, you can style `market-tooltip::part(popover)` directly using CSS.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Functionally and visually disables the tooltip trigger.

attributes.name: expanded
attributes.description:
Whether or not the tooltip is open. Setting it to true means it will be open
by default

attributes.name: interaction
attributes.description:
Defines what types of interaction the tooltip should have
(see `market-dropdown` docs for more granular explanation)

attributes.name: popover-distance
attributes.description:
Configuration option for Popper.js (used to position `<market-popover>`).
Displaces the popper away from, or toward, the reference element in the
direction of its placement.
https://popper.js.org/docs/v2/modifiers/offset/#distance-1

attributes.name: popover-placement
attributes.description:
Configuration option for Popper.js (used to position the tooltip overlay).
Describes the preferred placement of the popper.
https://popper.js.org/docs/v2/constructors//#placement

attributes.name: popover-skidding
attributes.description:
Configuration option for Popper.js (used to position `<market-popover>`).
Displaces the popover along the reference element.
https://popper.js.org/docs/v2/modifiers/offset/#skidding-1

attributes.name: popover-strategy
attributes.description:
Configuration option for Popper.js (used to position `<market-popover>`).
Describes the positioning strategy to use. By default, it is absolute. If
your reference element is in a fixed container, use the fixed strategy.
https://popper.js.org/docs/v2/constructors//#strategy
